RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 11600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 27 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Claiming Races For $4,500 Or Less Not Considered). (If necessary will be run SAME DISTANCE Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPEEDY MOONLITE rallied to press between horses at the quarter pole ceding a clear lead to foe in upper stretch surging ;late to get up abreast. CON ON THE RUN away alertly set the pace coming under pressure at the quarter pole shaking clear in upper stretch angling out when confronted late ceding in the final yards. AW ITE rushed up to vie outside of rivals on the turn dropping off in the four path upper stretch finishing evenly. FLYUNDERTHEGRAYDAR a step slow through the turn posed no menace. PERFECT PICTURE in close at the break dropped back early. KUKULKAN was always a step slow.

ENTRY.NAME: Kukulkan
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: always a step slow

ENTRY.NAME: Flyunderthegraydar
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Picture
ENTRY.COMMENT: in close dropped back early

ENTRY.NAME: Aw Ite
ENTRY.OWNER: Inman Betty Tunstall Shirley and Tunstall James
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed outside on turn, 4 wide lane, even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Speedy Moonlite
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, ceded clear lead to foe, surged up late

ENTRY.NAME: Con On the Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, pressed 1/4 pole, clear lane, angled out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 27 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PALACE PRINCE sat close up pressing to duel on the turn ceding a clear lead to foe in upper stretch rallying late to get up on the outside. TIMMY pressured the pace dueling to put a head in front on the turn edging clear in upper stretch being grabbed from the outside late. LUCKY JUNIOR rallied on the turn looming four wide into upper stretch angling inside mid stretch hanging late. SOUTHERN SENSE saved ground through the turn into upper stretch weakening there along the rail. GAGE HAS A GRAY pressed early wavering on the turn fading to upper stretch. NIGHT BOSS was never involved. PANORAMA TRUCK pressed early then gave way to pressure along the inside on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Night Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Southern Sense
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, weakened on rail lane

ENTRY.NAME: Panorama Truck
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early, gave way inside on turn

ENTRY.NAME: Timmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled on turn, clear top lane, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Junior
ENTRY.COMMENT: rallied on turn, loomed four wide top lane, angled inside, hung,

ENTRY.NAME: Gage Has a Gray
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early, faded to lane

ENTRY.NAME: Palace Prince
ENTRY.OWNER: Tijuana Racing Stables Tenenbaum Jeffrey and Bloom Jeffrey
ENTRY.COMMENT: close up, pressed bid turn, ceded lane, came again,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 27 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances)(W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility). (If necessary will be run SIX FURLONGS Main Track.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FANEUIL HALL pressed the pace dueling through the turn extending inside of rival in upper stretch digging deep to edge clear late. ALTMEISTER pressured the pace dueling abreast rivals through the turn then down the stretch being denied at the end. HEARTNESS stalked the pace angling out in upper stretch gaining some late at mid track needing more. CAJUN FUN slow early saved ground to upper stretch giving a mild rally along the rail. TIMBERRY TIDDLER pressured the pace between horses through the turn tiring in upper stretch. SUPPLY CHAIN broke slowly rushing wide through the turn flattening out in upper stretch. ANGELUS DIAMOND was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Supply Chain
ENTRY.OWNER: Bernardini Jay P Burnsworth Richard and Buyea Kristina
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, rushed outside, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.OWNER: Holly Ridge Farm, LLC and Collins, Timothy
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground to lane, mild rally on rail

ENTRY.NAME: Faneuil Hall
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled to lane, found more

ENTRY.NAME: Heartness
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, angled out lane, gained a bit, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Angelus Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Timberry Tiddler
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, tired lane

ENTRY.NAME: Altmeister
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled turn, abreast lane, out gamed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 8100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 27 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eli gibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Stewart William G and Cellini Rob

RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORTUNA ADIUVAT prompted the pace dueling through the far turn digging in abreast rival down the lane proving determined late. COURTED pressed on the backside dueling through the far turn battling from the inside down the lane pressing to the end. CROSSTOWN GIRL rallied on the far turn looming outside of rivals from mid track down the lane lacking a closing punch. DON'T TELL GRANDMA slow early saved ground to upper stretch posing no threat from the rail. CHORIST raced evenly throughout failing to reach contention. HOT AUGUST STORM pressed the pace through the backside giving way abruptly on the far turn easing in upper stretch jogging across wire walking off after the race.

ENTRY.NAME: Courted
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, dueled far turn, extended inside lane, battled

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Tell Grandma
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground to lane, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Crosstown Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: rallied in far turn, loomed mid track lane, lacked punch

ENTRY.NAME: Hot August Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, gave way far turn, eased lane, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Fortuna Adiuvat
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace, dueled far turn, dug in abreast lane, won out

ENTRY.NAME: Chorist
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, failed to respond,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 5F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 27, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 27 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Elig ibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KANFU pressed the pace wresting the lead while angling out in upper stretch holding rival at bay from there. UNTOUCHED ELEGANCE set the pace being pressed to the quarter pole ceding in upper stretch losing path there angling inside being held at bay to wire. LEADING INDICATOR slow early angled out in upper stretch moving up from mid track. CANELITA hustled along chased through the turn weakening in the four path down the lane. CATLIKE pressed early then faded inside. CYBERBURG slow early played no factor. SHAK'S HIDDEN GEM in tight near the seven sixteenths pole was not involved. TREASURED NIKKY chased early then faded on the turn.

ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, no factor,

ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early, faded inside

ENTRY.NAME: Canelita

ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight 7/16, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Kanfu
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, wrested lead angling out top lane, driving,

ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, ceded top lane, lost path, angled inside

ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, angled out lane, moved up late mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Treasured Nikky
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased early, faded on the turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 27 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing

RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUTTON BREEZE pressed the pace dueling early then on the turn shaking clear in upper stretch adding on late as much the best. KETO FRIENDLY pressed then chased on the turn proving no match for the winner down the lane keeping after it late getting up for place. ANGUSONIC pressured the pace dueling abreast rival on the turn being dispatched by foe in upper stretch clearly no match late weakening missing place. SALTY SNAPPER raced evenly throughout lacking more. CHASING A PAYDAY was never involved. CAPONE'S LOFT was always outrun.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: GINSBURNED pressed the pace dueling early edging to daylight on the turn shaking clear in upper stretch holding sway to wire. NICHOLAS JAMES raced evenly through the turn rallying in mid stretch finishing well near mid track saving place. EL CARDINAL pressured the pace through the turn being rebuffed in upper stretch weakening late on the inside. AS DE ORO COCO faded on the turn. TURN THE SWITCH was never involved.

UNION BROTHER saved ground surging into lane battling gamely from the rail to the wire. SUDDENLY SEDUCTIVE slow early raced six wide to upper stretch moving up late.
